name: Pumpkin Chile Vichyssoise
author: APERSONS
summary: Sweet pumpkin, smoky chiles, and tangy buttermilk make this a great cold-weather soup. Be creative with substituting other spices (cinnamon, ginger, cloves, cumin, etc.) to change the feel of the soup. It's great hot or cold with a bit of creme fraiche.
ingredients: 6  dried red chile peppers, stemmed and seeded
salt and ground black pepper to taste
directions: Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C)
Bake the pumpkin on a baking sheet in the preheated oven until soft, 30 to 40 minutes
Combine 2 cups chicken broth and chile peppers in a saucepan over medium-low heat; simmer for 30 minutes
Melt butter in a large stockpot over medium heat
Cook and stir onion in the butter until caramelized, about 45 minutes
Cook leeks in the same stockpot until tender, 10 to 15 minutes
Add pumpkin, chicken broth with chile peppers, caramelized onion, remaining 3 cups chicken broth, and cumin
Simmer until flavors combine, about 5 minutes
Puree soup with an immersion blender until smooth
Add bay leaf, salt, and pepper
Remove from heat; stir in buttermilk
